messages.content: holy SHIT fleeting embers is not trying hard enough
also
pyre is strong because you can get rid of starter cards and eventually get a stupidly refined deck
kindlings work even though they are against this because they have strong effects for free
this is a defend

Embers are bad unless you go into them very hard or have prismatic torch, and given the prevalence of boss swap, you aren't going to have prismatic torch very often even if you don't swap because A: it has to show up and B: you have to have embers already
also, embers clog your hand
can we also talk about how pyre needs to be nerfed?
pyre is NOT a cost
that's like saying oh true grit is kind of sketchy because it exhausts a card
pyre needs to only work if it pyres an ember or kindling

this would make embers actually worth taking, make fuel the fire (stupid strong card) need consistent support from kindlings or embers to get free ice cream energy instead of just making your deck smaller while also getting free energy
and the fact that embers retain would actually matter in more than "oh shit I can't get the full benefit from snecko eye because these stupid embers are everywhere"
I think the only good ember card is heat wave btw
Side note, this art looks more like an attack than a blocking skill to me
Sometimes all I think about is you
You're not playing Fleeting Embers for the block (although that is a useful benefit); you are playing it because it is a source of unlimited strength scaling a la <spot weakness>

embeds.title: Spot Weakness
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 :red_energy: / The Ironclad / Slay the Spire

If the enemy intends to attack, gain 3 (4) **Strength** :p_strength:.

messages.content: I agree that Pyre is powerful but I think it is fun, and a reasonable place to locate a good fraction of the character's power budget. Making pyre only trigger its benefits if it is deleting an ember or kindling sounds unfun to me and I would oppose it (a starter card is basically a blank to start the run?), although it's hard to know for certain without testing.

Not everything that is powerful needs to be nerfed, especially if the game design target of the mod is to be more flashy and wild (and less tightly balanced) than the base game, which I still assert is a good overall goal.
spot weakness gives way more strength and on a character with sword boomerang
starter relic used to give an ember
and after a point the relic gave a reserve once you burned the ember
this would make boss swap worse on the character and its currently way too good
And I also think the character is fun, but with a lot of A20 insight on the character, pyre needs changes
~~unupgraded true grit is sketchy though lmao~~
~~so pyre could be nerfed by giving it the unupgraded true grit treatment~~
oh god
remember that when I strikethrough things I am not being serious
This is a valid point

I like this card, it has a nice contained self synergy (it eventually scales your strength, and by providing block, it buys you time to safely wait until you can pyre the embers away). It's not a very efficient block card, but it can in theory provide significant scaling (theoretically it can be infinite) over the course of a fight. There is a bit of an issue in that collector already has access to very strong late game scaling in Dark Lord Form and the uncommon X cost power that gives you strength over the next 2 (3) turns, and so embers in general feel a little too cute in comparison. Depending on how heavily you are stacking doom, and how well you can afflict enemies, strength gain may also not be that useful on collector (especially in dark lord form runs), which can also hurt the utility of embers. 

I think Fleeting embers is at it's best when you haven't found those other scaling methods, have a good number of pyre cards, possibly a prismatic torch, or multiple copies of can't touch this to increase your dexterity and increase the self synergy. It can also be great with fiend fire, as a way to quickly burn up the embers and cash in on the strength scaling, while also avoiding potential hand clog issues. It's not a very good card early in the run, as a defensive skill, it's going to be pretty bad in all 3 act 1 elites, and most of the short hallway fights. The embers are usually going to pretty handy going into the act 1 boss, as they are an easy form of damage scaling that only asks you to have a few pyre cards, at a time when you haven't yet had a chance to get a ton of scaling yet. It's innifiency will probably cost you in act 2, which has a lot of fights involving frail, and some very demanding attacks that punish weak block cards like this (it is after all basically a defend on the turn you play it, the scaling won't matter until later in the fight). You should have more time to play a slow card like this in acts 3 and 4.

The upgrade is the same as a basic defend, I can't imagine ever prioritizing it, though at least it helps against frail. Reasonably good with ink bottle and letter opener, very useful with prismatic torch as a recurring source of multiple embers, can be good with warped tongs (it has a good shot at upgrading the embers over time since they retain). Any source of dexterity (oddly smooth stone, kunai, green key break, can't touch this) will help deal with the inefficiency of the initial block. I think this could reasonably be buffed to have better numbers, as it feels a little beat on the weaker side of collectors cards right now. 6 (9) block doesn't feel unreasonable, there are also other potentially more interesting directions the upgrade could go in (upgrade the embers, make more embers, reduce the cost).

One weird idea is to tie the card together more, maybe have it read "Add 2 embers into your hand. Gain 3 (5) block for each ember in your hand." It would be odd to have a reward for holding embers. Maybe a flurry of blows variant of some kind "0 cost card with Gain 3 (5) block. Whenever you exhaust an ember, return this from the discard pile to your hand."
make more embers might be worse
that said, I do like the idea of embers+

this card is good but it can run into issues when you have to many ember producing cards that can clog up your hand. Collector needs 6 open slots each turns to draw 5 cards + one from the collected pile, meaning playing this once and then playing another ember card like ashen strike nearly puts you to that limit if those embers are not all exhausted. Fortunately getting 2 embers at once is pretty good, offering valuable exhaust fodder for the dozens of good pyre cards; and since embers retain you can play this card preemptively. Being a conditional card this isnt one you take early in the rub but it does work to add support to decks that need more exhaust targets, since sometimes when drafting so many cards with pyre (which you want to do because they are all good) you can run into issues with not having enough cards in your hand to play them all and embers are there to help with that. The starter relic upgrade also works well with this and you can clog your hand on purpose to use fiend fire.
I think the card is a little weak relative to other stuff, but I think it's fine. I'd rather see the other stuffed brought down to around this level (maybe a bit stronger) and then see how it is.

I haven't gotten to play with this much yet since it's an uncommon that I generally wouldn't pick over a decent piece of kindling, but I did have an embers run with [[midas touch]] that was very silly and could easily have made good use of it. I'd take this happily if I had a good mass exhaust outlet like fiend fire or even purity, I don't think it quite gets there if you're just using pyre to exhaust things since it costs energy to make the embers which is less energy you can spend on pyre cards. So far in general though I've found myself really favoring cards that are either free embers or a full card of value without embers, rather than things that you play mostly for the embers they grant.
